item.title: A resident called to report that she saw a particular company dumping oil in a drain. She says she understand that this act is totally wrong and that the offender is committing a prohibited act that creates blockages, pollutes watercourses, and can lead to health and environmental problems., 1st September
item.description:
The resident says she has reported this act in the past. A particular company (residents of the area) regularly pour used oil into one of the drain. According to the customer, the perpetrator are at number 3 Merriam Avenue E9 5LS. They operate an event com
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Merriam Avenue, Hackney, London

item.title: Green tent with discarded BBQ, 1st September
item.description:
I just walked round the park 3 pm on Monday 1st September. This tent has appeared since I last walked round on Friday 29th August. This is a security matter to me as I feel threatened by the presence of this tent giving the impression someone is camping and I could be attacked. I was previously attacked along nearby Pool River Walk and will not walk there alone. I felt safe in the open space of Cator Park with more people around - until now. Is camping allowed in Cator Patk? Are BBQs allowed in Cator Park?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aldersmead Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
